attributes.action: put a pause on mortgage payments and house hold bills due to coronavirus
attributes.additional_details: The average person is one pay cheque away from being homeless at present we need stability. If the government doesn’t do this we have problems of people going out and trying to work whilst sick and spreading the virus
attributes.background: To stop extra worry and stress, pause mortgage, rent and household utilities in event of country on lockdown due to coronavirus to avoid virus spread

rejection.details:
Suspending payments for mortgages and other household bills is a matter for mortgage and service providers, and not the UK Government or Parliament.

We have published a petition calling for the Government to implement Universal Basic Income to give home and food security during the coronavirus outbreak: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302284

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/coronavirus-covid-19-information-for-the-public
